pros: The institution seems fair overall. They seem to do their due diligence to pay what is current in the job market. There are opportunities for growth over time and it is possible to work with some really amazing people.
cons: As with many institutions, internal politics is always a possibility. Be nice to people and it is very likely that things will go just fine.

pros: The production team is collaborative and supportive.
cons: The position isn't full time and the costume shop is understaffed.

review_title: An institution embracing pop-culture social issue and nepotism over organizational  accountability and integrity.
pros: Nice clean campus with nice landscaping.
cons: Affter a slipshod and ramshackle 9 month hiring process with no interview, no orientation, and sporidic direction for a 15/hr part time casual role,  the dysfunction did not end.   It's like a hybrid of corporate and gov't bureaucracy clusterfunk,  with the added arrogance of educational credentials combined with sophomoric worldviews, and communication skills permeated from a young and inexperienced student body.  Rules of engagement are extremely tribal.  Intra-department rivalry is heavy.  It's as if the culture thinks it's doing you a favor by allowing you to be a minion.  The gov't intitution then had the nerve to ask me to volunteer to do extra work.  Apparently the bubblegum-snappin clique mentality doesn't end in HS.

pros: People were amazing to work with and very supportive.
cons: The pay was way too low for the cost of living for that area of AZ. Make sure you look at housing in the surrounding areas to be sure you can afford it on an educator's salary.

pros: The pay is considerably low compared to other nursing jobs
cons: Low pay, expensive benefits. Difficult schedule depending on manager

review_title: Super lax and great start in the IT industry
job_title: IT Helpdesk Technician in Prescott, AZ
pros: Yavapai College is super laid back and everyone is fun to engage with
cons: No benefits for part-time or student workers

review_title: A great place with a lot of potential still to be realized
job_title: Instructional Support Assistant in Sedona, AZ
pros: Most people, staff and faculty, are incredibly supportive and will bend over backwards to lend a helping hand. The silent majority desperately want to move forward and adapt to current trends in higher ed.
cons: Administration and faculty don’t always get along . There is a small yet vocal minority that prevents progress and can be very toxic at times.

pros: Great benefits for fulltime employees.
cons: Pay is low, especially for the local cost of living.

pros: Small community feel. Most departments are relatively small and you get to know your colleagues.
cons: As adjunct faculty, you pay doesn’t start until the month after the semester begins.

cons: Decreased enrollment due to Covid-19 has resulted in fewer classroom assignments for adjunct faculty and I would like to work more

pros: Very friendly people laid back environment!
cons: Limited hours and short shifts

pros: Fair pay, good people to work with, room for growth.
cons: Politics that come with working at any organization.

pros: You are always learning and staying refreshed on what’s needed.

review_title: Was an amazing in ovotive college, now almost everything is on line.
pros: Clarkdale campus has brand new buildings. Beautiful library. Classes in wine & possibly soon horticulture. If you can find a live professor, working with them is rewarding.
cons: Totally underutilized. Students on  Clarkdale side have no choice but to take most of their classes 0n line & from what current students tell me there is little to no feed back. Almost everything is done in or through Prescott campus. Students & faculty are demoralized.

pros: Decent pay for 1/2 hour lessons, less so for hour lessons.
cons: Adjunct at a small community college, we're asked to do a lot without much compensation, but the department management has changed and is working to make it better.

pros: The community of Prescott Arizona and its environs are wonderful. The administration and faculty of Yavapai College are diverse, fascinating, and worldly.
cons: Prescott Arizona is a small city about 100 miles north of Phoenix with a spectacular year-round climate, but it sometimes lacks the amenities of a larger city.

pros: Wonderful people, culture, location, leadership and facilities
cons: Salary!  Almost impossible to live in the region on the wages provided.  Other non-tangible benefits help offset low wages.

pros: Great size, nice diversity, positive work atmosphere, good students, excellent athletics program.
cons: Just like any place, there is the potential for workplace politics.
